{"step_by_step_thinking": "The otic ganglion is a parasympathetic ganglion located in the infratemporal fossa. It receives preganglionic parasympathetic fibers from the glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX). These fibers synapse in the otic ganglion and then postganglionic fibers travel to innervate the parotid gland. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Glossopharyngeal nerve.", "answer_choice": "B"}
